Geometry¶

class rpw.geometry.Point(*xyz_or_tuple)¶

Bases: rpw.element.Element

DB.XYZ Wrapper

Allows setting of properties

>>> some_point = XYZ(0,0,0)
>>> pt = rpw.Point(some_point)
>>> pt.as_tuple
(0,0,0)
>>> pt.x = 10
<RPW_Point: 0,0,10>
>>> pt.at_z(5)
<RPW_Point: 0,0,5>
_revit_object¶

DB.XYZ – Wrapped DB.XYZ

__init__(*xyz_or_tuple)¶
Parameters:instance (DB.XYZ) – Instance of XYZ to be wrapped
as_tuple¶

Tuple representing the xyz coordinate of the Point

Returns:tuple float of XYZ values
Return type:(tuple)
at_z(z)¶

Returns a new point at the passed Z value

Parameters:z (float) – Elevation of new Points
Returns:New Points
Return type:(Point)
x¶

X Value

y¶

Y Value

z¶

Z Value

class rpw.geometry.PointCollection(points)¶

Bases: rpw.base.BaseObject

Provides helpful methods for managing a collection(list) of Point instances.

>>> points = [p1,p2,p3,p4, ...]
>>> point_collection = PointCollection(points)
point_collection.average¶
point_collection.min¶
point_collection.max¶
average¶

Returns PointElement representing average of point collection.

>>> points = [XYZ(0,0,0), XYZ(4,4,2)]
>>> points.average
(2,2,1)
max¶

Returns PointElement representing MAXIMUM of point collection.

>>> points = [(0,0,5), (2,2,2)]
>>> points.max
(2,2,5)
min¶

Returns PointElement representing MINIMUM of point collection. PointElement objects must support X,Y,Z attributes. Example: points = [(0,0,5), (2,2,2)] points.min = (0,0,2)
